command_results.body:
| ID  | Command | System | User | Time |
| --- | ------- | ------ | ---- | ---- |
~each var=$results~
| ~$item.id~ | ~$item.command_id~ | ~$item.system~ | ~$item.user~ | ~$item.responseTime~ |
~end~

users.body:
| ID  | Username | Email | Name | Account Locked |
| --- | -------- | ----- | ---- | -------------- |
~each var=$results~
| ~$item.id~ | ~$item.username~ | ~$item.email~ | ~$item.lastname~, ~$item.firstname~ | ~$item.account_locked~ |
~end~

systems.body:
| ID  | Hostname | Serial Number | OS  | Last Contact | Active |
| --- | -------- | ------------- | --- | ------------ | ------ |
~each var=$results~
| ~$item.id~ | ~$item.hostname~ | ~$item.serialNumber~ | ~$item.os~ ~$item.version~ | ~$item.ipList~ | ~$item.lastContact~ | ~$item.active~ |
~end~

commands.description: Commands for working with JumpCloud Commands
rules: when command is jumpcloud:commands must have jumpcloud:read

skip.description: Used with `list`. Skip number of results. Default 0

limit.description: Used with `list`. Limit number of results returned. Default 10

id.description: Required for `get`. Command ID to retrieve

rules: when command is jumpcloud:accounts must have jumpcloud:read
accounts.description: get a list of accounts that can be used for the `--account` option

rules: when command is jumpcloud:users must have jumpcloud:read
when command is jumpcloud:users with arg[0] == 'create' must have jumpcloud:write

username.description: Required for `create`. Username of new user

limit.description: Used with `list`. Limit number of results returned. Default 10

skip.description: Used with `list`. Skip number of results. Default 0

id.description: Required for `get`. ID of user to retrieve

email.description: Required for `create`. Email address of new user

users.examples:
jumpcloud:users list

jumpcloud:users get --id 58ac62df263162b92bfds32bf

jumpcloud:users create --email dlong@cagedata.com --username dlong

rules: when command is jumpcloud:tags must have jumpcloud:read

skip.description: Used with `list`. Skip number of results. Default 0

limit.description: Used with `list`. Limit number of results returned. Default 10

id.description: Required for `get`. Tag ID to retrieve

rules: when command is jumpcloud:results must have jumpcloud:read

skip.description: Used with `list`. Skip number of results. Default 0

limit.description: Used with `list`. Limit number of results returned. Default 10

id.description: Required for `get`. Command Result ID to retrieve

rules: when command is jumpcloud:systems must have jumpcloud:read

skip.description: Used with `list`. Skip number of results. Default 0

limit.description: Used with `list`. Limit number of results returned. Default 10

id.description: Required for `get`. System ID to retrieve

config.notes:
Want to manage multiple JumpCloud accounts? Setup multiple API keys by
appending an alias after `JUMPCLOUD_API_KEY` like
`JUMPCLOUD_API_KEY_EXAMPLE`. All commands support the `account` option to
select the account:

  ```
  jumpcloud:users --account example
  jumpcloud:systems --account example
  ```

Get a list of configured account with:

  ```
  jumpcloud:accounts
  ```
